video_title: 2019 OHL Priority Selection | Mason McTavish | Draft Profile

transcript.text: hi I'm Mason McTavish I play for the
Pembroke lumber Kings u18 and I'm from
Karp Ontario Mason McTavish is one of
the most gifted offensive players in
this in this year's draft he's a he's a
big kid protects the puck real well and
probably his biggest attribute is his
shot I haven't seen a 15 year old shoot
a puck like Mason does it's on a stick
it's off his stick he's got a quick
release and great velocity and pinpoint
accuracy Mason's a 200-foot player at
center he's very good in his own end and
when he gets that puck coming through
the neutral zone he's bullish he drives
hard and he's a big player and he's hard
to contain when he gets his feet moving
and he wants the puck on his stick he is
the go-to guy and he wants to score
goals or set up plays I'd say I'm a
playmaker and I like to shoot the puck
obviously I play with really good line
mates so it makes it a lot easier to do
what I can do I like to model my game
after Austin Matthews we're both pretty
big for H well my age I guess and yeah
we both I think we play the same way and
I look up to what would you say is the
strongest part of your game right now
I'd say the way I can see the play
develop and know where my teammates are
and knowing when they when they want the
puck and where they want it offensively
speaking he's a game breaker he can turn
the game over free in your favor almost
every time was on the ice he was voted
the MVP in the top prospect of ryu 18
league in the hto recently won a
championship with his team at Pembroke
lumber kings and they're deciding Game
three of the finals he scored five goals
they won five to one he scored the power
play scored short handed scored even
strength so he's an exceptional athlete
with a very high ceiling offensively
everybody's got to get a little bit
stronger a little bit faster before they
can take that next step with a couple
other things that you'll be working on
this offseason I'll be in the gym every
day and I work with Pat Malloy in the
summer he's a great skating coach and
yeah that's about it who's had the most
influence on your career
I definitely my mom my brother my might
they're both they're all like they'll
really help me out through the through
my career and hopefully they keep doing
that oh what's been your favorite hockey
moment I think it's definitely gonna be
this once it's all over it's gonna be I
think it's gonna be really fun and I'll
remember it over the years he's a
natural goal scorer with a heavy shot
and it's accurate and it's hard and it
gets to the net fast and he can put the
puck in the net many different ways and
around the net short-handed and like I
said with that heavy shot
if you could pick to dream line mates to
play on a line with who would be on a
line with you definitely Wayne Gretzky
and Mariela mio they're both best
players in though in the world so yeah
those do yeah I think it I think it all
depends on where he goes you know a lot
of you know a lot of the OHL is about
opportunity as a 16 year old so you know
if he gets given the opportunity to play
he is in the right spot in the right
situations I think he's got the skill
set to produce for sure and physically
you know he's ready to play in the
league this year you know he is a big
thick young man I think Mason with his
physical maturation with his offensive
abilities in his shot I think he can
step in and shoulder right away and have
an impact you can play anywhere in the
lineup he can do a number of jobs I
assume as being an impact player
immediately next year and what will mean
for you when you hear your name called
on draft morning it's gonna be very
exciting not too sure I'm gonna be in or
well on I'll end up but I'm sure it's
gonna be a really fun so anywhere
